step.cmd: Start running the classifier from the Menu -> Tasks -> Run Classifier in the main menu barclassifierrun
step.stepxmp:
The classification process takes minutes to run and consists of a number of passes. Some activity is displayed in the status bar of the workbench as shown below.
Classifier progress displayed in status bar
The progress can be monitored in the activity viewer. Classifier progress displayed in Activity Viewer
More detail is also available in the Workbench log file.
step.stepresult:
The running time for the Classifier can vary substantially from machine to machine. The following graphs were measured run on 2.8 GHz, single Pentium 4, 32-bit Windows XP system with 2.5GB of RAM and show the memory usage and CPU usage of time respectively. This particular run includes UK Extensions in addition to SNOMED. typical heap memory usage during classification
typical CPU usage during classification
If the classifier is run on a machine with limited computing resources it is recommended to not run other programs at the same time (i.e. take a break from the computer during the run.) This is not so much an issue with higher performance systems.
